<div>

<font size = 3px font color = "black" >Mathew Cieśla received his BA (*cum laude*) in psycholinguistics with a minor in German language and philology from New College at the University of Alabama. In 2022, he was awarded the prestigious Fulbright Scholarship (independent research grant) by the U.S.-Polish Fulbright Commission to conduct research at Adam Mickiewicz University, Poznań. Here, he collaborated with Drs. <a href = "https://anglistyka.amu.edu.pl/en/staff-list/katarzyna-jankowiak" target = "_blank">Katarzyna Jankowiak</a> and <a href = "https://www.bcbl.eu/en/conocenos/equipo/efthymia-kapnoula" target ="_blank"> Efthymia Kapnoual</a> comparing neural responses to orthographic and image referents in early-stage second language acquisition. Currently, Mathew is working toward his Ph.D. as a postgraduate researcher at the Department of Psychology, Northumbria University, Newcastle-Upon-Tyne, UK. He is supervised by <a href = "https://glennwilliams.me" target = "_blank">Dr. Glenn Williams</a> and co-supervised by <a href = "https://www.northumbria.ac.uk/about-us/our-staff/b/hazel-blythe/" target = "_blank">Dr. Hazel Blythe</a> and <a href = "https://www.abertay.ac.uk/staff-search/professor-vera-kempe/" target = "_blank">Dr. Vera Kempe</a>.

</font>
